If you disable CCSM Unity will stop working
There is a CCSM plugin called "Unity Plugin" or some such that will kill Unity if you disable it, or CCSM (obviously) :)
:) Oh, don't be afraid of it. Just make sure not to disable Unity. Because, well, that disables Unity. :)
Try resetting CCSM to all system defaults, logout, then log into "Ubuntu" (as opposed to "Ubuntu 2D" like I assume you just did)]
Alternatively, if you can't get Unity to work at all, you can (other than a complete reinstall) just use GNOME Shell instead, much like many others in this room
Well, have you re-enabled all plugins that were acvtive to begin with? (Namely, the "Unity Plugin" or whatever)
That is your problem. If "Ubuntu Unity Plugin" is disabled, then, consequently, Unity itself will be disabled.
No. But if Ubuntu Unity Plugin is disabled, simply marking it on again should suffice. You turned it off when you unchecked it.
Well, let's see if this works first. ;)
That worked great, thanks again. I won't use CCSM for a while :-)
A suggestion to re-acclamate yourself to it -- go to the Unity Plugin (click on the name, not the box), and go to the Experimental tab. You can change icon size and transparency and stuff.
Don't be afraid of it -- just respect its power. ;)
